Name: Louvre Museum
Description: Home to the Mona Lisa and thousands of other artworks

Name: British Museum
Description: A museum dedicated to human history, art, and culture
Address: Great Russell St, Bloomsbury, London WC1B 3DG

Name: Uffizi Gallery
Description: Renowned art museum housing some of the most important works of the Renaissance

Name: Rijksmuseum
Description: National museum dedicated to arts and history in Amsterdam

Name: Prado Museum
Description: Spanish national art museum featuring one of the finest collections of European art
Address: Calle de Ruiz de Alarcón, 23, 28014 Madrid

Name: Hermitage Museum
Description: One of the largest and oldest museums in the world, housing a comprehensive collection of art

Name: Centre Pompidou
Description: High-tech architecture housing the National Museum of Modern Art

Name: Tate Modern
Description: Modern art gallery housed in a former power station on the banks of the Thames

Name: Musee d'Orsay
Description: Art museum housing the largest collection of impressionist and post-Impressionist masterpieces
Address: 1 Rue de la Légion d'Honneur, 75007 Paris

Name: Acropolis Museum
Description: Museum focused on the findings of the archaeological site of the Acropolis of Athens

Name: State Historical Museum
Description: Showcases the history of Russia from ancient times

Name: Van Gogh Museum
Description: Dedicated to the works of Vincent van Gogh and his contemporaries

Name: Pergamon Museum
Description: Part of the Museum Island, showcasing ancient architecture

Name: National Gallery
Description: Art museum in Trafalgar Square in the City of Westminster, in Central London

Name: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía
The State Tretyakov Gallery
Description: Art gallery in Moscow, Russia, the foremost depository of Russian fine art in the world

Name: Scottish National Gallery
Description: National art gallery that holds the national collection of fine art

Name: Galleria dell'Accademia
Description: Art museum in Florence that houses Michelangelo's David

Name: Sistine Chapel
Description: Famous for its architecture, also the site of the Papal conclave
